intro: Cyanea calycina, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped, waxy leaves and thrives in coastal areas, often growing on rocky shores or in sandy soils. Cyanea calycina is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is an important part of the local ecosystem. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
